trans-unit.source: DROP TABLE removes the specified table.

seg-source.mrk: DROP TABLE removes the specified table.

target.mrk: DROP TABLE removes the specified table.

trans-unit.source: Triggers, constraints (primary, unique, check and references from the table being dropped) and indexes on the table are silently dropped. The existence of an open cursor that references a table being dropped causes the DROP TABLE statement to generate an error, and the table is not dropped.

seg-source.mrk: Triggers, constraints (primary, unique, check and references from the table being dropped) and indexes on the table are silently dropped.
The existence of an open cursor that references a table being dropped causes the DROP TABLE statement to generate an error, and the table is not dropped.

target.mrk: Triggers, constraints (primary, unique, check and references from the table being dropped) and indexes on the table are silently dropped.
The existence of an open cursor that references a table being dropped causes the DROP TABLE statement to generate an error, and the table is not dropped.

trans-unit.source: The DROP TABLE statement will also generate an error if the table is used in a view or trigger.

seg-source.mrk: The DROP TABLE statement will also generate an error if the table is used in a view or trigger.

target.mrk: The DROP TABLE statement will also generate an error if the table is used in a view or trigger.

trans-unit.source: Dropping a table invalidates statements that depend on the table. (Invalidating a statement causes it to be recompiled upon the next execution. See <xref href="crefsqlj22771.dita#crefsqlj22771"></xref>.)

seg-source.mrk: Dropping a table invalidates statements that depend on the table.
(Invalidating a statement causes it to be recompiled upon the next execution.

target.mrk: Dropping a table invalidates statements that depend on the table.
(Invalidating a statement causes it to be recompiled upon the next execution.
